description: Reconnects a session to a managed node after it has been disconnected.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Attackers can use valid credentials to reconnect to a previously disconnected session, allowing them to maintain persistent access to a system without re-authenticating.
By reconnecting to an active session, attackers can continue to upload malicious tools or scripts to the managed node without needing to initiate a new session, facilitating ongoing exploitation.
The reconnection process uses HTTPS, allowing attackers to maintain an encrypted communication channel, which could be used for executing commands or transferring data during the resumed session.

researchLinks.description: Attack Paths Into VMs in the Cloud

securityImplications: Attackers might use ResumeSession to gain unauthorized access to managed instances.
